name: Quantum Kush
description: If you are looking for a strain with ridiculously high THC content, Quantum Kush may just be the bud for you. Homegrown Natural Wonders originally produced this mix of Sweet Irish Kush and Timewreck, a combination that passes on a complex aroma that is both earthy and sweet. While the effects are strong, Quantum Kush provides clear-headed and relaxing effects perfect for those dealing with appetite loss, nausea, or depression.
descriptionPlain: If you are looking for a strain with ridiculously high THC content, Quantum Kush may just be the bud for you. Homegrown Natural Wonders originally produced this mix of Sweet Irish Kush and Timewreck, a combination that passes on a complex aroma that is both earthy and sweet. While the effects are strong, Quantum Kush provides clear-headed and relaxing effects perfect for those dealing with appetite loss, nausea, or depression.

highlightedReviews.text: Goooood stuff (4.5 stars)! The taste/aroma are wonderful (5/5) - so sweet and fruity. Smokes really smooth. Visually a stunning strain (5/5_ - lime green nugs absolutely covered in glistening trichs, super sticky. At ~28% thc, it packs a punch, but is surprisingly mellow for its strength. Happiness and euphoria are the main effects of this strain. The high (4/5) comes on like a sativa - pretty clear and uplifting - but it settles into a pretty heavy stoney body buzz. This strain is ideal for depression and low spirits, as well as anxiety due to its mellowness. The heavy finish to the effect makes it more appropriate for late afternoon/early evening consumption. A terrific balanced hybrid, IMO. Sure to be a regular in my head stash.

Basically all you want in a cannabis strain the sweet, pungent, and earthy with an immediate and intensive high which elevates you right off the bat.   The sweetness on the exhale, along with it's Sativa elevation gives this strain an extra grade on my top shelf list.  You'd never regret getting more than you'd wish for as it's a top strain you'd want to keep at least an eighth as your secret stash. 4.8/5.0 is my personal ratings, and a must try.  Your mood will get uplifted along with your good vibes.  This strain will keep you at good company and clear minded.   Indulging on Quantum Kush as we speak.  Straight-up Fire'n Gas

articles.title: The Top Trending Cannabis Strains of 2016
articles.author: Bailey Rahn
articles.text:
Every year we like to look back and recognize the rising stars of the cannabis world. Last year, GG4 (f.k.a Gorilla Glue #4), Critical Kush, Candyland, and ACDC were among the fastest trending strains according to Leafly user strain reviews, but which strains stood out from the crowd this year?
To eliminate outliers that might skew the results, we restricted our search to the top 200 ranking strains of 2016. These strains tend to be more available nationwide, and we hope you’re able to find them in your area!
Budtenders and inventory managers – are these trending strains on your menu? If not, consider keeping an eye out for them. Because in 2016, they were flying off the shelves fast.

#10. Blue Cookies

We all know that customers swarm around anything containing the word “Cookies,” thanks to the Girl Scout Cookie hype. But what makes Blue Cookies stand out from the many, many other Cookie crosses? The addition of Blueberry indica genetics, of course.
#9. Birthday Cake Kush

Another decadent GSC (f.k.a Girl Scout Cookies) cross, Birthday Cake Kush also pulls in genetics from Cherry Pie to achieve a dessert-like taste that’s not altogether unlike cake itself. It may not be your birthday, but the luxurious and relaxing qualities of this potent hybrid are certainly something to celebrate.
#8. Sour Tangie

The citrus-loaded sativa strain Tangie can’t possibly be improved. Or can it? DNA Genetics has done it again, spinning their Tangie masterpiece with the help of East Coast Sour Diesel genetics. Sour Tangie improves the fuel-like taste of Sour Diesel without compromising Sour D’s high-flying creative effects, making this sativa a must-have for flavor enthusiasts and artists alike.
#7. Purple Candy

Purple Candy blossomed in British Columbia, Canada. Believed to be a cross between BC Sweet Tooth and Mendocino Purps, it’s as sticky and sweet as grape hard candy. But you won’t feel a sugar rush with this indica; instead, expect the heavy-hitter to prime you for bedtime or a solid nap.
#6. Quantum Kush

A good sativa can lend a positive spark to an otherwise dreary day of chores, so it’s no wonder that Quantum Kush tipped the charts in 2016 as one of the fastest trending sativa strains. While some sativas bring on the buzz with a bit too much gusto, resulting in anxiety and paranoia, Quantum Kush manages to deliver creative, talkative, giggly qualities without what we like to call “The Fear.”
#5. God’s Green Crack

Who knew the not-so holy union of God Bud and Green Crack would result in something so heavenly? God Bud is known for producing mammoth yields of gargantuan buds, but the effects are a little heavy-handed for some. That’s why Jordan of the Islands crossbred God Bud with Green Crack, the high-flying sativa strain that focuses all of its effort on elevating the mind to a place where laughing fits are inevitable.
#4. Gelato

A new generation of GSC (f.k.a Girl Scout Cookies) has arrived, and its name is Gelato. From the same breeders that delivered fan favorites Sunset Sherbet and GSC (f.k.a Girl Scout Cookies), Cookie Fam Genetics from Bay Area, California isn’t finished with their royal line quite yet. Gelato, a descendent of Sunset Sherbet and Thin Mint GSC (f.k.a Girl Scout Cookies), blooms in bright colors that are almost as inviting as its tantalizing dessert-like aroma.
#3. Grape Stomper

Grape Stomper isn’t a new strain, but a jump in Leafly reviews will show that not all good things are sparkly and new. Strong genetics inherited from Purple Elephant and Chemdawg Sour Diesel equip this strain with the full package: flavor, potency, and consistency. Relaxing without encumbering social skills, the balanced Grape Stomper is an excellent choice for so many different activities. No wonder its popularity isn’t waning.
#2. Nuken

Nuken is also an older strain making a comeback. Originally found in Canada, it’s since proliferated throughout the Pacific Northwest to states like Washington and Oregon. Herbal and sweet in flavor, Nuken cradles you in a blanket of dreamy euphoria where your thoughts can float upward to bliss.
#1. Superglue

Last year, the top trending strain was GG4 (f.k.a Gorilla Glue #4). This year it’s Superglue, which surprisingly bears no family ties to last year’s champ. A cross between Northern Lights and Afghani, Superglue develops a thick coat of sticky resin that will quite literally glue your fingers together. Though its parentage may lead you to believe Superglue will be a knockout, this strain is bred to deliver more light-footed effects. In fact, Leafly users have described this strain as focusing and creative while simultaneously relaxing the body.

What was your favorite strain of 2016? We want to hear from you! Leave your most memorable cannabis varieties in the strain section below.

articles.title: New Strains Alert: Rare Darkness, Tutankhamon, Quantum Kush, Gemstone, and Tutti Frutti
articles.author: Bailey Rahn
articles.text:
This week's new strains are in! Whether you're looking to hole up with an indica and watch some Sunday football or planning on a hike with your favorite sativa, we've got a few recommendations for you. Another round of thanks to all of you who nominated new strains this week, and if you don't see your suggestion here, don't forget to check all the newest varieties in the Leafly Explorer!
   1. Rare Darkness
Characteristics of Rare Darkness:

Mostly indica
Cross between Rare Dankness #1 (Ghost OG, Chemdawg, and Triangle Kush) and Grape Ape
Breeder: Rare Dankness Seeds
Grape and berry aroma
Uplifting yet relaxed effects
May help with sleeplessness, headaches, and migraines

   2. Tutankhamon
Characteristics of Tutankhamon:

Mostly sativa
Contains AK-47 genetics
Breeder: Pyramid Seeds
Sour, skunky aroma
Social, creative effects

   3. Quantum Kush
Characteristics of Quantum Kush:

75/25 sativa-dominant strain
Cross between Sweet Irish Kush and Timewreck
Breeder: TGA Genetics
Earthy and sweet
Clear-headed, relaxing effects
May help with appetite loss, nausea, or depression

   4. Gemstone
Characteristics of Gemstone:

Hybrid strain
Cross between Skunk #1, Northern Lights, Lavender, and Sour Diesel
Flowery aroma
Deep, relaxing effects followed by a euphoric, energetic peak
May help with anxiety and pain

   5. Tutti Frutti
Characteristics of Tutti Frutti:

Autoflowering hybrid
Cross between Blue Haze, Green Haze, Thai
Breeder: Flash Seeds
Sweet fruity aroma
Uplifting, euphoric effects with a slow onset
